VCF Parsing

class fastdfe.parser.Parser(vcf_file: str, n: int, info_ancestral: str = 'AA', skip_not_polarized: bool = True, stratifications: typing.List[fastdfe.parser.Stratification] = [<fastdfe.parser.DegeneracyStratification object>], max_sites: int = inf, seed: int | None = 0)

Bases: object

Parse site-frequency spectra from VCF files.

By default, the parser looks at the AA tag in the VCF file’s info field to retrieve the correct polarization. Sites for which this tag is not well-defined are by default ignored. Note that non-polarized frequency spectra provide little information on the distribution of beneficial mutations.

Warning:

Not tested for polyploids.

__init__(vcf_file: str, n: int, info_ancestral: str = 'AA', skip_not_polarized: bool = True, stratifications: typing.List[fastdfe.parser.Stratification] = [<fastdfe.parser.DegeneracyStratification object>], max_sites: int = inf, seed: int | None = 0)

Initialize the parser.

Parameters:

  • vcf_file (str) – The VCF file to parse

  • n (int) – The number of individuals in the sample

  • info_ancestral (str) – The tag in the INFO field that contains the ancestral allele

  • skip_not_polarized (bool) – Whether to skip sites that are not polarized, i.e., without a valid info tag providing the ancestral allele

  • stratifications (List[Stratification]) – List of stratifications to use

  • max_sites (int) – Maximum number of sites to parse

  • seed (Optional[int]) – Seed for the random number generator

static open_file(file: str)

Open a file, either gzipped or not.

Parameters:

file (str) – File to open

Return type:

TextIO

Returns:

stream

count_lines_vcf()

Count the number of sites in the VCF file.

create_sfs_dictionary()

Create an SFS dictionary initialized with all possible base contexts.

Return type:

Returns:

parse()

Parse the VCF file and return the SFS.

Return type:

Spectra

Returns:

the spectra for the different stratifications

class fastdfe.parser.DegeneracyStratification(custom_callback: Optional[Callable[[cyvcf2.cyvcf2.Variant], str]] = None)

Bases: Stratification

Stratify SFS by degeneracy, i.e. whether a site is 4-fold degenerate (neutral) or 0-fold degenerate (selected).

__init__(custom_callback: Optional[Callable[[cyvcf2.cyvcf2.Variant], str]] = None)

Initialize the stratification.

Parameters:

custom_callback (Optional[Callable[[Variant], str]]) – Custom callback to determine the type of mutation

static get_degeneracy_default(variant: cyvcf2.cyvcf2.Variant)

Get degeneracy based on ‘Degeneracy’ tag.

Parameters:

variant (Variant) – The vcf site

Return type:

Optional[Literal['neutral', 'selected']]

Returns:

Type of the mutation

get_type(variant: cyvcf2.cyvcf2.Variant)

Get the base context for a given mutation with k flanking bases.

Parameters:

variant (Variant) – The vcf site

Return type:

Literal['neutral', 'selected']

Returns:

Type of the mutation

Raises:

NoTypeException – If the mutation is not synonymous or non-synonymous

get_types()

class fastdfe.parser.Stratification

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for Stratifying the SFS by determining a site’s type based on its properties.

abstract get_type(variant: cyvcf2.cyvcf2.Variant)

Get type of given Variant. Only the types given by get_types() are valid, or None if no type could be determined.

Parameters:

variant (Variant) – The vcf site

Return type:

Optional[str]

Returns:

Type of the variant

abstract get_types()

Get all possible types.

Return type:

List[str]

Returns:

List of types

class fastdfe.parser.NoTypeException

Bases: BaseException
